title: Proba-3 will constantly measure Sun’s energy output
summary: Proba-3 is such an ambitious mission that it needs more than one single spacecraft to succeed. In order for Proba-3’s Coronagraph spacecraft observe the Sun’s faint surrounding atmosphere, the disk-bearing Occulter spacecraft must block out the fiery solar disk. This means Proba-3’s Occulter ends up facing the Sun continuously, making it a valuable platform for science in its own right.

title: Attention Students: NASA Launches Power Systems Student Essay Contest
summary: NASA’s fourth annual Power to Explore Student Challenge kicked off November 7, 2024. The science, engineering, technology, and mathematics (STEM) writing challenge invites kindergarten through 12th grade students in the United States to learn about radioisotope power systems, a type of nuclear battery integral to many of NASA’s far-reaching space missions. Students are invited to […]

title: Bind Russia to a new arms control treaty to ban nuclear weapons in space
summary: Imagine strolling down the streets on a peaceful night in Honolulu and breathing in the fresh salt sea air. Feel the tiny detonation of air pressure as an orange glow […]

title: NASA MSR review continues despite committee leadership change
summary: NASA says it still expects to make a recommendation on a new architecture for the Mars Sample Return (MSR) program by the end of the year despite a change in leadership of a key review committee.

title: Former Intelsat executive joins Lynk Global as CEO
summary: Ramu Potarazu, a former executive at geostationary operator Intelsat, has taken the helm of Lynk Global in the direct-to-smartphone satellite venture’s latest leadership shake-up as it seeks funds to grow its constellation.

title: ESA Shares Rare Update on Themis Reusable Booster Demonstrator
summary: The European Space Agency has provided a rare update on the progress of its Themis reusable booster demonstrator project. Themis was initially a CNES project that was first announced in early 2018. In November 2019, during the ESA ministerial-level council meeting, member states agreed to fund the development of Themis with ArianeGroup as the project’s […]

title: Virgin Galactic seeks to raise money to accelerate growth of spaceplane fleet
summary: Virgin Galactic is proposing to raise $300 million in additional capital to accelerate production of suborbital spaceplanes and a mothership aircraft the company says can fuel its long-term growth.

title: SpaceX California launch slips two days
summary: The delay comes hours after SpaceX scrubbed another Starlink launch in Florida for a second time. Liftoff from pad 4E is set for Friday at 10:16 p.m. PST (1:16 a.m. EST, 0616 UTC on Saturday).

title: What Will A Second Trump Term Mean for Space Policy?
summary: Last night’s election of Donald Trump to return to the White House four years after he left office could portend significant changes in U.S. space activities. Or not. One day...

title: SpaceX plans next Starship flight for mid-November
summary: SpaceX has scheduled its next Starship test flight for as soon as Nov. 18, making incremental changes since the previous flight in October.
